div1.p:
United States Consulate
at St Paul de Loanda W.C.A.
March 10th 1882

L. de R. du Verge
to Dept of State
Oath of office and official bond.

opener.dateline:
United States Consulate
at St Paul de Loanda W.C.A.
March 10th 1882

div1.p: I have the honor to acknowledge the receipt of formal appointment paper Ns 1, 2, & 3, together with forms of oath, and official bonds. In reply I have the honor to hereby accept the office of Consul of the United States at St Paul de Loanda.

I have also to state that I was born in the Isle of France, that I am a naturalized citizen of the U.S. Evidence of which I have lodged in the Dept. and that I am appointed to my present office from the state of Maryland and my residence is the city of Baltimore and that I have
never resided in Portugal or any of its dependencies.

closer.salute:
I have the honor to be
Sir
Your obt svt
